metadata.title: CVE-2016-5140 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the opj_j2k_read_SQcd_SQcc function in j2k.cin OpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 52.0.2743.116,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly haveunspecified other impact via crafted JPEG 2000 data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1134').
